hanzi-su-wiki:
終

Значения

Кончаться; заканчивать, делать до конца; в конце концов

Мнемоника

  • Зима 冬, конец года. Женщины берутся за рукоделие 糸 (нитки).

  • "Наши отношения тянулись как нить 糸 в течение длительного времени, но они закончились зимой 冬."

Варианты

终

heisig_constituent: end, thread, spiderman, winter, walking legs, ice, drop, drop2

koohiiStory2: The thread of life begins with the spring and ends with the winter.

jp_example_words:
終わる(おわる): to finish, to close
終始(しゅうし): beginning and end, from beginning to end, doing a thing from beginning to end
終日(しゅうじつ): all day
終える(おえる): to finish
終る(おわる): finish, close
最終(さいしゅう): last, final, closing
始終(しじゅう): continuously, from beginning to end
終点(しゅうてん): terminus, last stop (e.g train)
終了(しゅうりょう): end, close, termination
終わり(おわり): the end
jp_readingExamples: 終える (お.える), 終わる (お.わる)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The thread of winter splits in two when the year comes to an end. One half symbolizes the year you were just in, and the other symbolizes the new year beginning, cutting winter in half and finishing off the year.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the threads that symbolize winter splitting in two to mark the end of the year. Winter isn't finished though, it's only half done.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Right as winter ends you grab the two threads and lace them into your shoes (しゅう). Oh, you thought these were metaphorical? No they're real threads, although, they're technically shoe laces now.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: It's the end of the year, so it's time for new shoe laces!
Ru_Radicals: 夂 (зима), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 糸 (нить)

zhōng: (нареч) в конечном счете, в конце концов
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the thread (糸) of winter (冬) comes to an end
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This winter is so cold that spiderman's web gets brittle! Could this be the end of spiderman?
humanum_full_description_en:
" final " A inscriptions as " winter ", " winter ", " end " Ancient with the word, " winter " as the first terminal of the rope knotted the shape, the original meaning of the terminal, and later extension of the end of 4:00 for the winter " Winter ", see " Winter ". The seal script starts with the sound of "糸" and " winter ", and the original meaning is knotted at the end of the rope. "Said Wen": "At the end, Yusi also. Cong Shidong sound. Kuo, the end of ancient writing." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. "Closed Diagnosis Ceremony" Jane 65: "Zhongbei Luanquan in the east of the chamber in Bingsei (Zi) County, Nanxiang (xiang), with a sock as big as a big finger, and the neck is connected with a spin, and the end is in the neck."

" End " can mean the ending of a thing, as opposed to " beginning ". "Poetry, Daya, Dang": "There is no beginning to be extravagant, but an end to seldom overcomes."

" Finally " can mean the death of a person. "Book of Rites‧The Prince of Wen": "The Ninety-seven King of Wen is the end."

" Finally " also means after all. "Mozi-Tianzhizhong": "If you want to ask for praise, you will never get it."

" End " also means the whole and the end. "Xunzi: Encouraging Learning": "I have tasted all the time and think about it, it is better to learn what I have to learn."

" End " also means both. "Poetry‧Beifeng‧North Gate": "At the end I will be poor and poor, I don't know how difficult I am."

" End " is also used as a unit to quantify area, time, and movement. For example, in the Book of Han Dynasty, Criminal Law Records: "One mile in a place is a well; ten wells are through, ten miles are through, and ten miles are square; ten miles are final." Zuo Zhuan‧The Ninth Year of Xianggong": "Twelve years is one end." "The Book of Rites-Rural Drinking Righteousness": "Working into the country, promoting the song to the third end." Kong Yingdashu: "The Song of Shengtang "Deer Ming" , "Four Mu", "Emperor and Emperor Hua", each one ends."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The seal script starts with the sound of "糸" and " winter ". The original meaning is knotted at the end of the rope.
humanum_full_description:
「終」甲金文作「冬」，「冬」、「終」古本同字，「冬」最初象繩的終端打結之形，本義是終端，後來才引伸四時的終結為冬天的「冬」，參見「冬」。篆文從「糸」，「冬」聲，本義為繩的終端打結。《說文》：「終，絿絲也。从糸冬聲。夂，古文終。」《睡虎地秦簡．封診式》簡65：「丙死（屍）縣其室東內中北廦權，南鄉（嚮），以枲索大如大指，旋通繫頸，旋終在項。」

　　「終」可表示事物的結局，與「始」相對。《詩‧大雅‧蕩》：「靡不有初，鮮克有終。」

　　「終」可表示人的死亡。《禮記‧文王世子》：「文王九十七乃終。」

　　「終」還表示終究。《墨子‧天志中》：「欲以此求賞譽，終不可得。」

　　「終」亦表示整個、盡。《荀子‧勸學》：「吾嘗終日而思矣，不如須臾之所學也。」

　　「終」還表示既。《詩‧邶風‧北門》：「終窶且貧，莫知我艱。」

　　「終」還作量化面積、時間、樂章的單位，如《漢書‧刑法志》：「地方一里為井；井十為通，通十為成，成方十里；成十為終。」 《左傳‧襄公九年》：「十二年矣，是謂一終。」 《禮記‧鄉飲酒義》：「工入，升歌三終。」孔穎達疏：「謂升堂歌《鹿鳴》、《四牡》、《皇皇者華》，每一篇而一終也。」
humanum_short_description: 篆文從「糸」，「冬」聲，本義為繩的終端打結。

①末了(liǎo)，完了(liǎo)，與“始”相對：年終。終場(末了一場)。終極。終審(司法部門對案件的最後判決)。終端。靡不有初，鮮克有終(人們做事無不有開頭，而很少能堅持到底)。
②從開始到末了：終年。終生。飽食終日。
③人死：臨終。送終。
④到底，總歸：終歸。終究。終於。終將成功。
⑤姓氏。

「 終 」甲金文作「 冬 」，「 冬 」、「 終 」古本同字，「 冬 」最初象繩的終端打結之形，本義是終端，後來才引伸四時的終結為冬天的「 冬 」，參見「 冬 」。篆文從「 糸 」，「 冬 」聲，本義為繩的終端打結。《說文》：「終，絿絲也。从糸冬聲。夂，古文終。」《睡虎地秦簡．封診式》簡65：「丙死（屍）縣其室東內中北廦權，南鄉（嚮），以枲索大如大指，旋通繫頸，旋終在項。」 「 終 」可表示事物的結局，與「 始 」相對。《詩‧大雅‧蕩》：「靡不有初，鮮克有終。」 「 終 」可表示人的死亡。《禮記‧文王世子》：「文王九十七乃終。」 「 終 」還表示終究。《墨子‧天志中》：「欲以此求賞譽，終不可得。」 「 終 」亦表示整個、盡。《荀子‧勸學》：「吾嘗終日而思矣，不如須臾之所學也。」 「 終 」還表示既。《詩‧邶風‧北門》：「終窶且貧，莫知我艱。」 「 終 」還作量化面積、時間、樂章的單位，如《漢書‧刑法志》：「地方一里為井；井十為通，通十為成，成方十里；成十為終。」 《左傳‧襄公九年》：「十二年矣，是謂一終。」 《禮記‧鄉飲酒義》：「工入，升歌三終。」孔穎達疏：「謂升堂歌《鹿鳴》、《四牡》、《皇皇者華》，每一篇而一終也。」
" final" A inscriptions as " winter", " winter", " end" Ancient with the word, " winter" as the first terminal of the rope knotted the shape, the original meaning of the terminal, and later extension of the end of 4:00 for the winter " Winter", see " Winter". The seal script starts with the sound of " 糸" and " winter", and the original meaning is knotted at the end of the rope. "Said Wen": "At the end, Yusi also. Cong Shidong sound. Kuo, the end of ancient writing." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. "Closed Diagnosis Ceremony" Jane 65: "Zhongbei Luanquan in the east of the chamber in Bingsei (Zi) County, Nanxiang (xiang), with a sock as big as a big finger, and the neck is connected with a spin, and the end is in the neck." " End" can mean the ending of a thing, as opposed to " beginning". "Poetry, Daya, Dang": "There is no beginning to be extravagant, but an end to seldom overcomes." " Finally" can mean the death of a person. "Book of Rites‧The Prince of Wen": "The Ninety-seven King of Wen is the end." " Finally" also means after all. "Mozi-Tianzhizhong": "If you want to ask for praise, you will never get it." " End" also means the whole and the end. "Xunzi: Encouraging Learning": "I have tasted all the time and think about it, it is better to learn what I have to learn." " End" also means both. "Poetry‧Beifeng‧North Gate": "At the end I will be poor and poor, I don't know how difficult I am." " End" is also used as a unit to quantify area, time, and movement. For example, in the Book of Han Dynasty, Criminal Law Records: "One mile in a place is a well; ten wells are through, ten miles are through, and ten miles are square; ten miles are final." Zuo Zhuan‧The Ninth Year of Xianggong": "Twelve years is one end." "The Book of Rites-Rural Drinking Righteousness": "Working into the country, promoting the song to the third end." Kong Yingdashu: "The Song of Shengtang "Deer Ming" , "Four Mu", "Emperor and Emperor Hua", each one ends."

終字的基本解释

終
zhōng
见“终”。

終字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhōng］
［《廣韻》職戎切，平東，章。］
“终1”的繁体字。
(1)事物的结局。与“始”相对。
(2)人死。
(3)到底；终究。
(4)竟；尽。
(5)既。
(6)纵使；虽然。
(7)古代田地面积单位。
(8)古以十二年为一终。
(9)古乐章以奏诗一篇，乐一成为一终。
(10)古代月在壬称终。见《尔雅·释天》。
(11)姓。汉有终军。见《汉书》本传。

終字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　終； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页921第01
〔古文〕????????夊【廣韻】職戎切【集韻】【韻會】之戎切，?音螽。【說文】絿絲也。　又【玉篇】極也，窮也。【集韻】一曰盡也。【易·繫辭】《易》之爲書也，原始要終。【書·仲虺之誥】愼厥終，惟其始。【詩·大雅】高朗令終。　又【禮·檀弓】君子曰終，小人曰死。　又【左傳·文元年】先王之正，時也。履端于始，舉正于中，歸餘于終。【疏】歸其餘，分置于終末。言於終末乃置閏也。　又【左傳·襄九年】十二年矣，是謂一終，一星終也。　又【爾雅·釋天】月在壬曰終。　又【前漢·?法志】地方一里爲井，井十爲通，通十爲成，成方十里，成十爲終。　又姓。【左傳·定四年】殷民七族，有終葵氏。【史記·秦本紀】秦之先爲嬴姓，其後分封，以國爲姓，有終黎氏。【前漢·終軍傳】終軍，字子雲，濟南人也。　又【韻補】叶諸仍切。【周易·坤·文言】以終叶成。　又【韻補】叶諸良切。【陳琳·迷迭香賦】竭歡慶於夙夜兮，雖幽翳而彌彰。事罔隆而不殺兮，亦無始而不終。

楷体

Basic explanation of words

zhōng

end
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhōng］
["Guangyun" Job Rongqie, Pingdong, Chapter. ]
Traditional characters for "end 1".
(1) The ending of things. Contrast with "beginning".
(2) People die.
(3) In the end; after all.
(4) Completely; exhausted.
(5) Both.
(6) Even though; though.
(7) Ancient unit of field area.
(8) In ancient times, twelve years was the end.
(9) The ancient music chapter is composed of a poem, and the music one becomes the end.
(10) The ancient moon ended in Ren. See "Erya·Shitian".
(11) Last name. Han has a final army. See the biography of "Han Shu".
end

[Poetry·Daya] Gao Lang ordered the end.　[Li·Tan Gong] The gentleman said the end, the villain said death.　[Zuo Zhuan·Wen Yuan Year] Xian Wang Zhizheng, Shi Ye. The end is at the beginning, the right is at the middle, and the rest is at the end. 【Sparse】Return to the rest, placed at the end. To say that at the end is to set a leap too.　[Zuo Zhuan·Xiang Nine Years] Twelve years, it means that one end, one star ends.　[Erya·Shitian] The month ends in Renye.　 [Previous Han·Fazhi] One mile in a place is a well, a well ten is a pass, a ten is a pass, a square is ten li, and a ten is the end.　Another last name. [Zuo Zhuan·Ding Four Years] There are seven families of Yin people, and there is the final Kui clan. [Historical Records·Qin Benji] Qin's surname was Ying first, followed by confession, with the country as the surname, and the final Li family. [Previous Han · Final Army Biography] Final Army, the word is Ziyun, and it is also from Jinan.　[Rhyme Supplement] Ye Zhu is still cutting. 【Zhou Yi·Kun·Classical Chinese】It is made by the final leaves.　[Rhyme Filling] Ye Zhuliang cut. [Chen Lin·Rosemary Fu] Celebrate all night, although it is faint and clear. There is no beginning but no end.

Name meaning

zhōng
вм. 终

終

Значения

Кончаться; заканчивать, делать до конца; в конце концов

Мнемоника

  • Зима 冬, конец года. Женщины берутся за рукоделие 糸 (нитки).

  • "Наши отношения тянулись как нить 糸 в течение длительного времени, но они закончились зимой 冬."

Варианты

终

Radicals: 糸, 夂, 二  (thread, winter, two)
Meaning Mnemonic
The thread of winter splits in two when the year comes to an end. One half symbolizes the year you were just in, and the other symbolizes the new year beginning, cutting winter in half and finishing off the year.
Picture the threads that symbolize winter splitting in two to mark the end of the year. Winter isn't finished though, it's only half done.
Reading Mnemonic
Right as winter ends you grab the two threads and lace them into your shoes (しゅう). Oh, you thought these were metaphorical? No they're real threads, although, they're technically shoe laces now.
It's the end of the year, so it's time for new shoe laces!
